articles.headline: In a Battle of the E-Readers, Booksellers Spurn Superheroes
articles.snippet: Amazon struck a deal for the exclusive digital rights to a hundred graphic novels by DC Comics, leading Barnes & Noble and Books-a-Million to remove the novels from their shelves.
articles.abstract: Amazon struck a deal for the exclusive digital rights to a hundred graphic novels by DC Comics, leading Barnes & Noble and Books-a-Million to remove the novels from their shelves.
articles.lead_paragraph: The tablet wars have begun. Superheroes are the prize — or perhaps the victim.

articles.headline: Airlines Battle Back to Profit, a Fare and a Fee at a Time
articles.snippet: The rising ticket prices and mushrooming fees that annoy air travelers have helped airlines make money during the economic downturn.
articles.abstract: The rising ticket prices and mushrooming fees that annoy air travelers have helped airlines make money during the economic downturn.
articles.lead_paragraph: The same things making many air travelers grumble these days — rising fares with more and more fees, fewer flights, planes filled to the brim — are the things giving airline executives a reason to smile.

articles.headline: Chasing Opportunity in an Age of Upheaval
articles.snippet: Wealthy investors fall into three categories right now: the bargain hunters, the natural resource crowd and the bettors.
articles.abstract: Wealthy investors fall into three categories right now: the bargain hunters, the natural resource crowd and the bettors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nicolas Berggruen is passionate about investing. A compact, handsome billionaire, Mr. Berggruen is often talked about for his eccentricities — he does not own a home, preferring to jet around the world and live out of hotels — but his ability to find, invest in and turn around neglected companies points to a hardened and savvy approach.

articles.headline: Protests Are a Payday for Security Firms
articles.snippet: For the high-end security firms that protect the moneyed elite, Occupy Wall Street has been a stimulus package all its own.
articles.abstract: For the high-end security firms that protect the moneyed elite, Occupy Wall Street has been a stimulus package all its own.
articles.lead_paragraph: They call when they make the Forbes 400 list. They call when annual hedge fund rankings appear, when their names are mentioned on CNBC and when their children travel abroad. And, these days, they call when protesters camped in Lower Manhattan grow uncomfortable with the idea of their existence.

articles.headline: A Fierce Clash for Romney and Perry as Republican Candidates Debate
articles.snippet: In the most contentious of the debates so far, Mitt Romney came under attack from the other Republican presidential candidates, signaling the start of a tough new phase of the campaign.
articles.abstract: In the most contentious of the debates so far, Mitt Romney came under attack from the other Republican presidential candidates, signaling the start of a tough new phase of the campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Mitt Romney came under intensive attack from his rivals for the Republican presidential nomination at a debate here Tuesday night, with a newly assertive Rick Perry leading a sometimes personal barrage against him on conservative consistency, health care policy and even the immigration status of yard workers at his home.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Battle for a Holdout City Stalls Healing in Libya
articles.snippet: The battle for Surt underscores the problem Libya’s weak transitional government faces as it tries to stitch together a country divided by the war.
articles.abstract: The battle for Surt underscores the problem Libya’s weak transitional government faces as it tries to stitch together a country divided by the war.
articles.lead_paragraph: SURT, Libya — The commander, defying a shower of bullets, urged his men to train their heavy weapons on a nest of pro-Qaddafi snipers in a school down the street. But then someone said that the loyalists had asked to surrender, and he told his men to hold their fire. It was a hopeful moment. After weeks of violence, the fighters were exhausted, the city was destroyed and hundreds of civilians were trapped in their homes in the area.

articles.headline: Gloom Grips Consumers, and It May Be Home Prices
articles.snippet: The United States has a confidence problem, and a growing number of economists argue that the collapse of housing prices plays a major role.
articles.abstract: The United States has a confidence problem, and a growing number of economists argue that the collapse of housing prices plays a major role.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — Ernest Markey lost his stone-cutting business in 2009. He then sold his home for half a million dollars less than its value at the peak of the housing bubble and moved with his wife, Marie, to a smaller home in a less affluent suburb. They gave up two new cars and bought one. Used.

articles.headline: In Rift Between Murdochs, Heir Becomes Less Apparent
articles.snippet: Rupert Murdoch reached his boiling point last winter, a former official said, and delivered a blunt ultimatum to his son James: “You’re coming back to New York, or you’re out.”
articles.abstract: Rupert Murdoch reached his boiling point last winter, a former official said, and delivered a blunt ultimatum to his son James: “You’re coming back to New York, or you’re out.”
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It was a striking display of unity: Rupert and James Murdoch, father and son, walking side by side through central London as they faced a crisis that had laid siege to their company. Pushing through a crush of paparazzi on a street not far from Buckingham Palace, James reached out to place a reassuring hand on his father’s back.

articles.headline: U.S. Solar Panel Makers Say China Violated Trade Rules
articles.snippet: A trade case accuses Chinese makers of using government subsidies to help gain sales in the American market.
articles.abstract: A trade case accuses Chinese makers of using government subsidies to help gain sales in the American market.
articles.lead_paragraph: Seven American makers of solar panels filed a broad trade case in Washington against the Chinese solar industry on Wednesday, accusing it of using billions of dollars in government subsidies to help gain sales in the American market.
